author: The Telegraph
title: Salmon dip recipe by Heston Blumenthal
text: Discover more summer recipes » Pack a picnic and head outside this summer. Whether you spread a rug in the garden, at the park, by the sea or on a hill with a view, it’s probably the best way to enjoy a fabulous lunch. Here, chef Heston Blumenthal sprinkles some of his Michelin star magic on a picnic favourite. His salmon dip is quick and easy to make and has amazing textures and taste, as Heston explains. "By combining two forms of salmon – chargrilled and tea smoked – you get a variety of texture and complexity of flavour," he says. "We then introduce a lively piquancy to the creamy smoothness with sliced pickled shallots and sushi ginger." Heston's salmon dip Preparation time 15 minutes plus cooling Cooking time 6-8 minutes Ingredients • 2 echalion shallots, finely sliced • 70g caster sugar • 100ml white wine vinegar • 300g pack salmon fillets • 100g pack Heston from Waitrose lapsang souchong tea smoked salmon, diced • 40g soured cream • 30g crème fraîche • Zest of 1⁄2 lemon • Squeeze of lemon • 50g sushi ginger, drained and finely sliced • 6g fresh chives Method 1. To pickle the shallots, put the sugar and vinegar into a pan over medium- high heat and bring to the boil then pour it over the shallots and let it all cool. 2. Season the salmon fillets with salt and barbecue them for around 3 minutes each side, until medium to well- cooked. Remove from the barbecue and cool. Fork the salmon into small flakes in a bowl. 3. Add smoked salmon, soured cream, crème fraîche, lemon zest and juice to the flaked salmon. 4. Drain the shallots and combine with the sushi ginger and chives. Add to the salmon mixture. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve With crackers or freshly baked baguette. Your summer of food Over the coming weeks, the Telegraph and Waitrose are featuring exciting and original recipes and videos from Michelin-starred chef Heston Blumenthal. Different themes and new ideas each week will help make alfresco eating and home entertaining extra special. Using ingredients from Waitrose and the Heston from Waitrose range, these will bring flair to food whether you’re enjoying it at the table, in the garden or great outdoors. This week’s theme is picnics and Heston has made a video of how to prepare his Scotch quail eggs , with lovely soft yolk centres, which could be enjoyed with the salmon dip.
